message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV 

The paper discusses methods for option discovery in reinforcement learning, which involves learning a set of subgoals or options that can be used to decompose a task into smaller subtasks. This is a topic that is relevant to several subfields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), systems and control (cs.SY), and computer vision (cs.CV). Given that the paper focuses on a machine learning approach to option discovery, cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely categories. However, the paper also discusses the applicability of learned options to robotics and control tasks, which suggests that cs.RO and cs.SY are also relevant. Finally, the paper includes experiments on visual navigation tasks, which suggests that cs.CV may also be a relevant category.
